sen.j: 天ヶ瀬ダム（あまがせダム）は京都府宇治市、一級河川・淀川本川中流部、通称宇治川と呼ばれる流域に建設されたダムである。
sen.e: Located in Uji City of Kyoto Prefecture, Amagase Dam stands at Uji-gawa River which is the common name of the middle reaches of the main stream of Yodo-gawa River, a first-class river.
Located in Uji City in Kyoto Prefecture, Amagase Dam is on the Uji-gawa River, the common name of the middle reaches of the main stream of Yodo-gawa River, which is known as a first-class river.
sen.cmt: 「of」→「in」, 「stands at」→「is on the」, 「which is」→「,」, 「which is known as」挿入
sen.e: Located in Uji City in Kyoto Prefecture, Amagase Dam is on the Uji-gawa River, the common name of the middle reaches of the main stream of the Yodo-gawa River, which is known as a first-class river.
sen.cmt: "Yodo-gawa River" -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: 国土交通省近畿地方整備局が管理する国土交通省直轄ダムで、西日本屈指の大河川・淀川本流に建設された唯一のダム。
sen.e: This is a ministry-controlled dam under Kinki Regional Development Bureau of Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, and it is the only dam built at the main stream of Yodo-gawa River, one of the greatest rivers in western Japan.

This is a ministry-controlled dam under the Kinki Regional Development Bureau of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, and it is the only dam built on the main stream of Yodo-gawa River, one of the greatest rivers in western Japan.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入x2, 「at」→「on」
sen.e: This is a ministry-controlled dam under the Kinki Regional Development Bureau of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, and it is the only dam built on the main stream of the Yodo-gawa River, one of the greatest rivers in western Japan.
sen.cmt: "Yodo-gawa River" -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: 高さ73.0メートルのアーチ式コンクリートダムで、淀川の治水と宇治市への上水道供給、総出力59万8,000ワットにも及ぶ水力発電を目的とした多目的ダム特定多目的ダムである。
sen.e: Measuring 73.0 meters tall, it is an arched dam of concrete, built as a specified multipurpose dam with the aims of flood control of Uji-gawa River, supplying drinking water to Uji City, and the hydroelectric power generation up to 598-thousand watts.

Measuring 73.0 meters in height, it is an arched dam of concrete, built as a specified multipurpose dam with the multiple aims of the flood control of Uji-gawa River, supplying drinking water to Uji City, and the hydroelectric power generation of up to 598-thousand watts.
sen.cmt: 「tall」→「in height」, 「multiple」挿入,「the」挿入,「of」挿入
sen.e: Measuring 73.0 meters in height, it is an arched dam of concrete, built as a specified multipurpose dam with the multiple aims of the flood control of the Uji-gawa River, supplying drinking water to Uji City, and the hydroelectric power generation of up to 598-thousand watts.
sen.cmt: "Uji-gawa River" -> "the Uji-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: 現在ダム機能の強化を目的にバイパストンネル建設を柱とするダム再開発事業を計画中である。
sen.e: There is a plan for a renewal project of the dam featuring a bypass tunnel construction to extend functions of the dam.
There is a plan in place for a renewal project, featuring the construction of a bypass tunnel to extend the functions of the dam.
sen.cmt: 「in place」挿入, 「of the dam」削除, 「,」挿入, 「the」挿入, 「construction」箇所異動
sen.e: There is a plan in place for a renewal project, featuring the construction of a bypass tunnel to extend the functions of the dam.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ダムによって形成された人造湖は鳳凰湖（ほうおうこ）と命名され、平等院鳳凰堂などと共に宇治地域の主要な観光地となっている。
sen.e: The lake made by the dam is named "Ho-o Lake," and is an important tourist attraction in Uji area along with Byodo-in Temple Hoo-do.
The lake made as a result of the construction of the dam is named "Ho-o Lake," and is an important tourist attraction in the Uji area along with Byodo-in Temple Hoo-do.
sen.cmt: 「by」→「as a result of the construction of」,「the」挿入,
sen.e: The lake made as a result of the construction of the dam is named Lake Ho-o, and is an important tourist attraction in the Uji area along with Hoo-do Hall (the Phoenix Pavilion) of Byodo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをとり、Lake Ho-oとし、「平等院鳳凰堂」の表記を修正しました。

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: History
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 淀川は大阪市・京都市といった日本屈指の大都市を貫流する極めて重要な水系であり、古来より治水・利水は間断なく繰り返されていたが、洪水も頻繁であり当時の為政者達の悩みの種でもあった。
sen.e: As Yodo-gawa River is an extremely important water resource that runs through Japan's major cities, Osaka and Kyoto, utilization and flood-control works of this river had been regularly carried out since ancient times, but frequent floods kept bothering rulers in those days.

Yodo-gawa River is an extremely important water resource that runs through two of Japan's major cities, Osaka and Kyoto, and the utilization of its water and flood-control of the river have been regularly carried out from ancient times, but even so frequent floods repeatedly caused problems for rulers in those days.
sen.cmt: 「As」削除, 「two of」挿入, 「utilization and flood control works of this river had」→「and the utilization of its water and flood control of the river have」, 「since」→「from」, 「even so」挿入,「kept bothering」→「repeatedly caused problems for」
sen.e: The Yodo-gawa River is an extremely important water resource that runs through two of Japan's major cities, Osaka and Kyoto, and the utilization of its water and flood-control of the river have been regularly carried out from ancient times, but even so frequent floods repeatedly caused problems for rulers in those days.
sen.cmt: "Yodo-gawa River" -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: 戦後森林の乱伐等で全国的に水害が多発したが淀川でも例外ではなく、1953年（昭和28年）の台風13号では宇治川の堤防が決壊し宇治市等流域市町村に多大な損害を与えた。
sen.e: Excessive logging after the War caused many floods across the country including Yodo-gawa River, where Typhoon 13th of 1953 broke down levees on Uji-gawa River to inflict serious damages to Uji City and the areas around the river.

Excessive logging after the War caused many floods across the country including at Yodo-gawa River, where Typhoon 13 of the 1953 season broke the levees of the Uji-gawa River and inflicted serious damage to Uji City and the areas around the river.
sen.cmt: 「at」挿入, 「13th of 1953」→「13 of the 1953 season」, 「down」→「the」, 「on」→「of the」, 「to inflict serious damages」→「and inflicted serious damage」
sen.e: Excessive logging after the War caused many floods across the country including at the Yodo-gawa River, where Typhoon 13 of the 1953 season broke the levees of the Uji-gawa River and inflicted serious damage to Uji City and the areas around the river.
sen.cmt: "Yodo-gawa River" -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: この台風13号での淀川の洪水流量は過去最悪のものであり、これを機に淀川流域の根本的な治水対策として建設省近畿地方建設局（現・国土交通省近畿地方整備局）は「淀川水系改修基本計画」を実施。
sen.e: The fact that Typhoon 13th produced the worst amount of flood water of Yodo-gawa River in the history made the Kinki Regional Construction Bureau of Construction Ministry (present Kinki Regional Development Bureau of Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport) to implement "the Basic Plan to Repair Yodo-gawa Water System" as a drastic measure of flood control throughout the Yodo-gawa area.
sen.cmt: 建設省近畿地方建設局→Kinki Regional Construction Bureau of Construction Ministry[定訳不明淀川水系改修基本計画→the Basic Plan to Repair Yodo-gawa Water System[定訳不明
sen.e: The fact that Typhoon 13 caused the greatest volume of flood water yet at Yodo-gawa River made the Kinki Regional Construction Bureau of the Construction Ministry (the present Kinki Regional Development Bureau of Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport) implement "the Basic Plan to Repair Yodo-gawa Water System", a drastic measure of flood control throughout the Yodo-gawa area.
sen.cmt: 「13th produced the worst amount of flood water of Yodo-gawa River in the history」→「13 caused the greatest volume of flood water yet at Yodo-gawa River」, 「the」挿入, 「to」削除,「as」→「,」
sen.e: The fact that Typhoon 13 caused the greatest volume of flood water yet at the Yodo-gawa River made the Kinki Regional Construction Bureau of the Construction Ministry (the present Kinki Regional Development Bureau of Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport) implement 'the Basic Plan to Repair the Yodo-gawa River System,' a drastic measure of flood control throughout the Yodo-gawa River area.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマの位置を移動、 Yodo-gawa River System、Yodo-gawa River areaとしました。"Yodo-gawa River" -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: この計画の一環として計画されたのが天ヶ瀬ダムである。
sen.e: Building Amagase Dam was included in this plan.
The building of Amagase Dam was included in this plan.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入,「of」挿入
sen.e: The building of Amagase Dam was included in this plan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 数多くのダムが建設されている淀川水系の中にあって、淀川本川に建設された唯一のダムであり、淀川水系における多目的ダムの第1号でもある。
sen.e: Among many dams in Yodo-gawa River System, this dam is the only dam and the first multipurpose dam built at the main stream of Yodo-gawa River.
Among the many dams of the Yodo-gawa River System, this dam is the only dam and the first multipurpose dam built on the main stream of Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入, 「in」→「of the」, 「at」→「on」,
sen.e: Among the many dams of the Yodo-gawa River System, this dam is the only dam and the first multipurpose dam built on the main stream of the Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: Yodo-gawa River -> "the Yodo-gawa River" に変更しました。

sen.j: ダムの高さは73.0m、型式はアーチ式コンクリートダムであるが、このダムは「ドーム型アーチ式コンクリートダム」というアーチダムの一型式である。
sen.e: Measruing 73.0 meters tall, it is an arch type concrete dam called "concrete dome arch dam," one of the types of arch dam.
Measuring 73.0 meters in height, it is an arch type concrete dam of the "concrete dome arch dam" type.
sen.cmt: 「Measruing」→「Measuring」, 「tall」→「in height」,「called」→「of the」, 「dam," one of the types of arch dam.」→「dam" type.」
sen.e: Measuring 73.0 meters in height, it is an arch type concrete dam of the 'concrete dome arch dam' type.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: この型は設計が極めて難しいタイプのアーチダムであるが、コンクリートの使用量が少なくて済む為経済性に優れた型のダムである。
sen.e: Although this type is very hard to design, it is economically advanced because it uses less concrete than other types.
Although this type is very hard to design, it is economically advanced because it uses less concrete than other types.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Although this type is very hard to design, it is economically advanced because it uses less concrete than other types.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 殿山ダム（日置川）で初めて採用され、その後黒部ダム（黒部川）等日本有数のダムに応用された。
sen.e: This design was first applied to Tonoyama Dam (Hiki-gawa River), and later to major dams in Japan such as Kurobe Dam (Kurobe-gawa River).
This design was first applied to Tonoyama Dam (Hiki-gawa River), and later to major dams in Japan such as Kurobe Dam (Kurobe-gawa River).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This design was first applied to Tonoyama Dam (Hiki-gawa River), and later to major dams in Japan such as Kurobe Dam (Kurobe-gawa River).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 洪水調節・京都府南部への上水道供給の他、ダム建設に伴って1924年（大正13年）に建設された関西電力の志津川ダム（大峯ダム。重力式コンクリートダム・31.2ｍ）が水没する為、その代替施設としての天ヶ瀬発電所による水力発電を目的とした多目的ダムである。
sen.e: Amagase dam is a multipurpose dam not only for flood control and supply of drinking water to the south of Kyoto Prefecture, but also for the hydroelectric generation at Amagese Power Station which was built to replace the power plant of Kansai Electric Power Co., INC. at Shizugawa Dam (Omine Dam: concrete gravity dam of 31.2 m in height) that had to be under the water of Amagase dam.

Amagase dam is a multipurpose dam not only for flood control and the supply of drinking water to the south of Kyoto Prefecture, but also for hydroelectric generation at Amagase Power Station, which was built to replace the power plant of Kansai Electric Power Co., INC. at Shizugawa Dam (Omine Dam: a concrete gravity dam of 31.2 m in height) which was submerged as a result of the construction of Amagase dam.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入, 「the」削除,「Amagese」→「Amagase」, 「a」挿入,「that had to be under the water」→「which was submerged as a result of the construction」
sen.e: Amagase Dam is a multipurpose dam not only for flood control and the supply of drinking water to the south of Kyoto Prefecture, but also for hydroelectric generation at Amagase Power Station, which was built to replace the power plant of Kansai Electric Power Co., INC. at Shizugawa Dam (Omine Dam: a concrete gravity dam of 31.2 meters in height) which was submerged as a result of the construction of Amagase Dam.
sen.cmt: 他の表記と合わせAmagase Damとし、m→metersとしました。

sen.j: 尚、発電に関してはその後、喜撰山ダムが1970年（昭和45年）に完成し喜撰山発電所と揚水発電（認可出力466,000kW）を行っている。
sen.e: This power plant and Kisenyama Power Station at Kisenyama Dam which was completed in 1970 generate power by pumped-storage hydroelectricity (permitted output: 466,000 kW).
This power plant and Kisenyama Power Station at Kisenyama Dam which was completed in 1970 generate power by pumped-storage hydroelectricity (permitted output: 466,000 kW).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This power plant and Kisenyama Power Station at Kisenyama Dam which was completed in 1970 generate power by pumped-storage hydroelectricity (permitted output: 466,000 kW).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 観光地としてのダム
sen.e: Dam as a tourist attraction
The dam as a tourist attraction
sen.cmt: 「The」挿入
sen.e: The Dam as a Tourist Attraction
sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: このダムは宇治市街に近い都市型ダムである。
sen.e: It is an "urban type" dam close to Uji City urban area.
It is an "urban type" dam close to Uji City.
sen.cmt: 「urban area」削除
sen.e: It is an "urban type" dam close to Uji City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ダムより2.3kmの至近距離に世界文化遺産に登録された平等院や宇治橋、天ヶ瀬森林公園がある。
sen.e: Very close to this dam, within 2.3 km from it, are Uji Byodo-in that is a World Heritage Site, Uji-bashi Bridge, and Amagase Forest Park.
Within as little as 2.3 km from this dam are Uji Byodo-in (a World Heritage Site), Uji-bashi Bridge, and Amagase Forest Park.
sen.cmt: 「Very close to this dam, within 2.3 km from it,」→「Within as little as 2.3 km from this dam」, 「that is」→「()」
sen.e: Within as little as 2.3 km from this dam are Byodo-in Temple (a World Heritage Site), Uji-bashi Bridge, and Amagase Forest Park.
sen.cmt: Uji Byodo-in→Byodo-in Templeとしました。

sen.j: 又京都市内にも近く、京滋バイパスを利用する事で大津市・比叡山・石山寺にも近く、こうした事から観光バス等を連ねて観光客が多く訪れる。
sen.e: Many tourists visit this dam by sightseeing bus, because it is close to Kyoto City, and from here Keiji Bypass provides easy access to Otsu City, Hiei-zan Mountain, and Ishiyama-dera Temple.
Many tourists visit this dam by sightseeing bus, because it is close to Kyoto City, and from here Keiji Bypass provides easy access to Otsu City, Hiei-zan Mountain, and Ishiyama-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Many tourists visit this dam by sightseeing bus, because it is close to Kyoto City, and from here Keiji Bypass provides easy access to Otsu City, Mt. Hiei, and Ishiyama-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 統一事項に基づき、Hiei-zan Mountain→Mt. Hieiに修正

sen.j: 遠足や社会科見学等で関西地方の小学生が訪問することでも知られる。
sen.e: This dam is also popular among elementary school children in Kansai region who visit it on a school excursion or on a social studies trip.
This dam is also popular among elementary school children in the Kansai region, who visit it on school excursions or social studies trips.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入, 「a school excursion」→「school excursions」, 「on a social studies trip」→「social studies trips」
sen.e: This dam is also popular among elementary school children in the Kansai region, who visit it on school excursions or social studies trips.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ダム湖は1987年（昭和62年）に平等院鳳凰堂が近いこと、ドーム形アーチ式である堤体の形が、羽を広げた鳳凰に見えること等に因んで「鳳凰湖」と名付けられた。
sen.e: The lake was named "Ho-o Lade" in 1987, because it is close to Byodo-in Temple Hoo-do and the dam body looks like a ho-o (a phoenix) with its wings extended.
The lake was named "Ho-o Lake" in 1987, because it is close to Byodo-in Temple Hoo-do and the dam body looks like a ho-o (a phoenix) with its wings extended.
sen.cmt: 「Lade」→「Lake」
sen.e: The lake was named 'Lake Ho-o' in 1987, because it is close to Hoo-do Hall of Byodo-in Temple and the dam body looks like a ho-o (a phoenix) with its wings extended.
sen.cmt: 「平等院鳳凰堂」の表記を修正、"Ho-o Lake"→'Lake Ho-o'としました。

sen.j: サクラや紅葉の名所でもある。
sen.e: It has also scenic spots of cherry blossoms and colored leaves.
It has also scenic spots of cherry blossoms and colored leaves.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It has also scenic spots of cherry blossoms and colored leaves.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）より、洪水調節機能の強化と新規利水を目指し国内最大級の放水路トンネルを建設する「天ヶ瀬ダム再開発計画」が進められていた。
sen.e: The "Renewal Plan of Amagase Dam" had been underway since 1989 to strengthen the function of flood control and to build the biggest tailrace tunnel in Japan for a new utilization of its water.
sen.cmt: 天ヶ瀬ダム再開発計画→Renewal Plan of Amagase Dam[定訳不明]
sen.e: The "Renewal Plan of Amagase Dam" had been underway since 1989 to strengthen the functions of flood control and to build the biggest tailrace tunnel in Japan for a greater utilization of its water.
sen.cmt: 「function」→「functions」, 「new」→「greater」
sen.e: The 'Renewal Plan of Amagase Dam' had been underway since 1989 to strengthen the functions of flood control and to build the biggest tailrace tunnel in Japan for a greater utilization of its water.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: だが、反対運動や水需要の減少等により2003年（平成15年）に計画の見直しが図られた。
sen.e: However, the plan was reassessed in 2003 due to opposition movements and the decline of water demand.
However, the plan was reassessed in 2003 due to opposition movements and a decline in water demand.
sen.cmt: 「the decline of」→「a decline in」
sen.e: However, the plan was reassessed in 2003 due to opposition movements and a decline in water demand.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）の淀川水系流域委員会による答申でも計画中止が妥当とされ、国土交通省は事業を継続する意向を示しているものの、事業は頓挫しているに等しい状態となっている。
sen.e: Although the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport intends to continue this project, the Yodogawa River System Committee has recommended to abandon the plan, so the project is almost dead.
sen.cmt: 淀川水系流域委員会→Yodogawa River System Committee（淀川水系流域委員会）[定訳不明]
sen.e: Although the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport intends to continue this project, the Yodogawa River System Committee has recommended to abandon the plan, so the project is considered to be unlikely to reach completion.
sen.cmt: 「almost dead」→「considered to be unlikely to reach completion」
sen.e: Although the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport intends to continue this project, the Yodo-gawa River System Committee has recommended to abandon the plan, so the project is considered to be unlikely to reach completion.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを入れ、Yodo-gawaとしました。
